answers.answer: A normal fasting blood sugar would make diabetes unlikely.Testing the blood for the creatinine level can evaluate for any renal disorders.If you are male, a rectal exam should be done to exclude an enlarged prostate.A metabolic panel can be done to evaluate the sodium levels.  A low level should be a tipoff for diseases like SIADH which may lead to your symptoms.These options can be discussed with your personal physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com

question: My urination is normal during the day, but I am often waking up to pee LARGE volumes at night and if I do make it through the night, I am peeing well OVER A LITER first thing in the morning and waking up extremely thirsty.  Something is obviously acting as a diuretic during sleep.  My fasting blood sugar at last check was 85 so it can't possibly be glucose, right?  My prostate is fine.  My doctor just shrugs and says not to worry about it.  Can you think of any possibilities?
title: Something is acting as a diuretic at night
